poem:
Title: In the Halls of Uncommon Dialogue

Unfurling in chambers of small chairs,
English roses in bloom amid disputes of gender.
A toolkit dresses in legal jargon's attire,
Wafting worries in Brighton's soft seaside air.
Oh, respect is a fine gown of intent,
But etches questions deep in parental hearts.
In the classroom's lyrical, echoing drama,
Who knows where the lesson starts?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The toolkit, introduced by Brighton and Hove council in 2021 and subsequently replicated by a number of other local authorities, says schools should “respect” a child’s request to change their". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
